medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 3-day history of abdominal pain that started as mild cramping in the lower abdomen. This pain progressed to diffuse abdominal bloating. She experienced increasingly severe pain, localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), with sharp stabbing pains occurring later. The patient reported taking Gas-ex without relief. She denies nausea, vomiting, fevers, chills, diarrhea, constipation, anorexia, or dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Melanoma; past surgical history includes excision of melanoma from the right arm.
